message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio  
• From the balance sheet, Total Liabilities are not directly given but can be computed by subtracting Total Owner's Equity from Total Liabilities and Owner’s Equity.  
  Total Liabilities = Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity – Total Owner's Equity  
   = 30858088.75 – 29842166.21  
   = 1015922.54  
• Total Assets = 30858088.75  
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
  = 1015922.54 / 30858088.75 ≈ 0.0329  
 Rounded to two decimals, this is approximately 0.03.

Step 2: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -18924462.44  
• From the income statement, Net Profit = 1842166.21  
• Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit  
  = -18924462.44 / 1842166.21 ≈ -10.27

Thus, the final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.03",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-10.27"
  }
}
